stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds—part arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.

stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

preGame:
Step right up, ghouls and guests! It's Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the hallowed, or should I say 'hollowed', Oakmaul Grounds in Hafting! We are kicking off the Losers Bracket of the playoffs, and the tension in the air is thicker than a swamp-troll's neck! This is Game 1 of a Best-of-3 series, and let me tell you, there is no room for error when your survival in the tournament is on the line! This ritualistic stadium is buzzing with a crowd that is part-fanbase, part-congregation, and all-bloodthirsty!

On our home side, we have The Greenwatch! These Warden-loving heroes are out here rubbing trollballs in their armpits—looking at you, Verne Methuselah—and trying to talk to the local pigeons! I see Goldenberg Rimola is currently whistling at a crow, likely hoping for a tactical advantage, while Nobe Haukom is busy plucking hairs from teammates' beards for luck! It’s ritual central down there under the shadow of the Scarred Oak, but will their fancy superstitions save them from a good old-fashioned beating? I doubt it!

But don't count out the visitors, The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures! They’ve arrived with a rebellious spirit and a thirst for mayhem that would make Lord Orzalon proud! I just saw Boulanger Procto meticulously arranging his broadsword and seax in a perfect spiral on the grass—truly a work of art before the inevitable slaughter! Wolbrom Ariella is currently serenading the crowd with a sea shanty so out of tune it’s technically a war crime! It’s going to be a beautiful, bloody afternoon of Trollball, folks! Let’s get to the action!
postGame:
Holy cow, what a humdinger of a match! If you like your sports with a side of internal bleeding and a dash of disappointment for the 'heroes' of the realm, then the Oakmaul Grounds was the place to be today! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures didn't just win; they delivered a 4-0 shutout that has left the Hafting locals quieter than a graveyard! It was a masterpiece of mayhem from the very first whistle!

The action started fast in Center Field when Verne Methuselah snagged the head, but the defense was ready! Darin Berliner decided that Fogel Raynold’s face looked better horizontal, delivering a tackle that sent Raynold straight to the healer! It was a textbook display of brutality, but the Chaos Creatures weren't about to let a little thing like a shattered jaw slow them down!

Mouldon Earl struck back almost immediately, showing Rese Halpern that the 'Greenwatch' should have been watching their own backs! Earl sent Halpern to the dirt with a crunch that echoed off the Scarred Oak! Not to be outdone, Tucker Hett used that billhook to hook Drona Jacklin right out of the play! The injury list was growing faster than the betting pools!

And how about those sticky fingers? Herriott Dhiren tried a wild pass that looked more like a prayer, and Wolbrom Ariella was there to answer it with a stunning interception! But the Greenwatch fought back, with Rese Halpern snagging a pass right out of the air from Gabriele Klehm! It was a back-and-forth scramble that had the crowd roaring for more blood!

By the time halftime rolled around, the field looked like a butcher's shop, but the healers got everyone back on their feet for a second half that was even more chaotic! The Greenwatch seemed to find their second wind, with Verne Methuselah putting Alben Diantha on the injury list, and Madea Mensch doing the same to Mouldon Earl! It was a regular carousel of carnage!

Despite the Greenwatch's attempts to dominate the physical game, the Chaos Creatures showed they have the eyes of a hawk! Salahi Bushey and Goldenberg Rimola were busy cracking skulls, taking out Placido Kora and Raouf Dragone respectively, but they forgot one very important thing—the ball! While the 'heroes' were busy posing, the Chaos Creatures were moving!

Let's talk about that first score! Boulanger Procto, the man with the aesthetically pleasing gear, showed he has an aesthetically pleasing arm! He wound up from the Home 2-Point zone and launched that leather troll head right through the hoops! Two points on the board for Monteforte, and you could feel the air leave the stadium!

But the Creatures weren't done! Alben Diantha, freshly returned from a beating, decided to show the Wardens how it's done! From all the way back in Center Field, he let out a scream and fired a shot that would have made Sir Randy's fancy bow look like a toy! It sailed through for another two points, doubling the lead and silencing the ritual-singers!

The Greenwatch looked like they'd spent too much time talking to birds and not enough time practicing their blocks! Even with Troy Jorgan and Darin Berliner trying to claw back some dignity with late-game tackles, the Chaos Creatures held firm! Fogel Raynold was scrambling all over Center Field, keeping the possession away from the desperate home team!

Final score: The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures 4, The Greenwatch 0! A complete shutout in the opening game of the series! It just goes to show you that all the morning dew and armpit rubbing in the world won't save you when a Chaos Creature decides to put a ball through your hoop! We'll see if the Greenwatch can find their spines for Game 2, or if they'll be headed for the exit! For Tuesday Night Trollball, I'm Nok the Corrupter! See you at the next slaughter!
